candidates.title: Add unexpected cfgs to `[lints]` table
candidates.body:
With the release of rust-lang/cargo#13913 (in nightly-2024-05-19), there is no longer any need for the kind of workarounds employed in #3660. Cargo has now gain the ability to declare `--check-cfg` args directly inside the `[lints]` table with [`[lints.rust.unexpected_cfgs.check-cfg]`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/rustc/check-cfg/cargo-specifics.html#check-cfg-in-lintsrust-table)[^1]:

`Cargo.toml`:
```toml
[lints.rust]
unexpected_cfgs = { level = "warn", check-cfg = ['cfg(hyper_unstable_tracing,hyper_unstable_ffi)'] }
```

This PR adds those unexpected cfgs inside the `[lints]`, reverts #3660 and remove the manual `--cfg docsrs` (since it's automaticly added by docs.rs).

[^1]: take effect on Rust 1.80 (current nightly), is ignored on Rust 1.79 (current beta), and produce an unused warning below

candidates.title: refactor(h1): use UninitSlice::as_uninit_slice_mut() instead of cast
chore(lib): update to 2021 edition
candidates.body:
Our MSRV is already past when 2021 edition was introduced, so might as well. It gets us a the better resolver for dependencies.

Closes #3541

candidates.title: feat(http2): add config for max_local_error_reset_streams in server
candidates.body: This change exposes a tunable for the max_local_error_reset_streams parameter in h2.

candidates.title: feat(http1): support configurable `max_headers`
candidates.body:
Recently we encountered a problem when using `hyper`.

After the client sent the request, it received response `431 Request Header Fields Too Large`. After investigation, we found that `hyper` sets an upper limit on the number of `headers`, and this upper limit is a fixed and non-configurable value.

#3283 also encountered similar problems.

This PR sets `max_headers` to a configurable value. Its default value remains the same as the previous code, and we can set this value when needed.

Additionally, unit tests have been added and the current code passes.

candidates.title: test(benches): re-enable end-to-end http2 chunked benchmarks
refactor(lib): remove lint config to allow unused code
candidates.body: Removes the lint configs of allowing unused code, and adds features `cfg` attributes to them.
